      • setNoRecursionCheck

        public void setNoRecursionCheck(boolean noRecursionCheck)
        Sets flag for no recursion check. This flag is inspired by classes like java.awt.Dimension which contain property of the type java.awt.Dimension thus causing endless loop while recursively introspecting beans. Normally we suppress recursion but in some situations this screens out required properties. In such situation the developer can use this flag to aviod recusrion suppresion, but he may be required to write BeanInfo for the class in this case.
        See Also:
        BeanInfoConstants.NO_RECURSION_CHECK

      • setCanBeNull

        public void setCanBeNull(boolean value)

      • setCompositeEditor

        public void setCompositeEditor(String propertyNameList,
                               LayoutManager layoutManager)
        Sets up a composite editor for the property.
        Parameters:
        propertyList - List of property names for composite editor.

        Semicolon is used as a delimiter of property names.

        Nested subproperties can be used i.e. properties can be referenced via complete name.

        Examples:

        • "color;width;stroke"
        • "pen/color;pen/width;brush/stroke"
        layoutManager - Layout manager to arrange property renderers/editors inside the composite editor.

        Currently meaningful layout managers are only: GridLayout and FlowLayout.

        See Also:
        BeanInfoConstants.COMPOSITE_EDITOR_PROPERTY_LIST, BeanInfoConstants.COMPOSITE_EDITOR_LAYOUT_MANAGER

      • setResizable

        public void setResizable(Boolean value)
        Specifies that number of elements of the indexed property can be changed at run time.
        Parameters:
        value - value of the attribute.
        See Also:
        IndexedPropertyConstants.RESIZABLE
